Riot has almost only ever buffed towers. Patch 5.22 had a bug in it which took out the armor+mr which was meant to scale up over time to make towers incredibly more tanky than before. Lazer turrets do much more DPS than a standard tower, but the community acts like it does less. The tower shield buff was broken and removed because it basically killed split pushing and sieging which is why last season was such a teamfight meta.
Other tower buffs have included towers targetting quicker and completing their attack no matter what(end of season 4), towers taking reduced damage for the first few minutes of the game(mid season 4 I think?), and towers gaining much more armor without any minions around.

At the beginning of season 4 you could literally walk up to inhib towers with a split pusher and no minions and solo it with 80% of your health remaining. It was common to take two inhibs+inhib towers with your tank not even taking any damage if you out-rotated your opponent.

The "community" is basically every rager on the forum than got outplayed on a tower dive and came to complain. Riot always buffs towers

i thought that dota 2 towers had less damage no? i mean everyone is saying this but i never played the game tho.

They have a lower DPS, and their aggro rules work in a very exploitable way. So long as you have creeps, the tower won't start targeting you unless you autoattack the enemy hero (or unless you're the closest thing autoattacking the tower). You can nuke them with spells all you like and nothing bad will happen to you. Even if you do draw aggro, you can drop it by trying to autoattack one of your own creeps. Towerdiving is so much easier.... well, assuming no one on the enemy team responds to it.

The real threat Dota 2 towers pose is as TP locations. Damage is a secondary function.
They have lower DPS, but have a higher attack speed so if they begin to target you, they will always get one attack off and on average 2.

Yeah, but that's only really relevant for the "I accidentally stepped into tower range" scenario (and to be fair, they are about equal to League's towers there). For purposeful dives, the fact that their damage doesn't ramp up at all for successive shots, they don't have any armor penetration, and they can be easily retargeted onto other allies or your minions means that they end up being way weaker if someone is diving you. It's the jackass Lion teleporting in to CC you, drain all your mana and then finger you to death that you have to fear when you're diving.

I haven't seen a TP ganker more obnoxious than Lion, but man, Enigma comes close. TP in, stunlock, D&D, eidolon a minion, ult, and you're dead (unless you get BKB, but that's not something people usually rush)

Also not as much as a TP ganker as he is a pure ganker, but my god, Io with Ursa is a nightmare.

Well, if he's ulting you and using eidolon damage, BKB certainly isn't going to help. Magic immunity is feeble against the power of black holes. Useful against Malefice though.

Io Ursa can certainly be a terror, but it's the Io Tiny that always gives me headaches.

Yeah that's what I mean

BKB can avoid Malefice which makes landing Black Hole that much harder (especially if you're someone slippery like PA)

Idk if it's just me but Io Tiny always seems to lack damage to me. Idk. Maybe it's because I'm used to playing Axe, so I don't suffer much from that combo and turn it around pretty easily with a well-placed Taunt xP
Most of the time I see Axe get torn apart by an Io+Tiny gank. QW from Tiny and the Spirits from Io do some pretty heavy damage paired with Tiny's high base damage and Io's attack speed increase.

I suppose. In my defense, though, I play gank/roam Axe, so I tend to pick up kills here and there before anyone really builds any major ticket items.

That being said, I play with low level scrubs like me, so I think it's because everyone sucks at my level. xD
They deal alot less damage per shot, but they fire at a _significantly_ high rate and have a much longer range so they tend to be more punishing

More punishing.... nah.

Not only is their relative DPS significantly lower than League towers, but they also won't target you until you right click an ally, and you can deaggro them onto allied creeps at any time you want. They're really not punishing at all.

I can 100 - 0 towerdive someone at level 3 in Dota. Couldn't do that in League unless something almost miraculiously stupid happened.

their damage is quite pitiful. In dota 2 carries like adc's actually gain armor per level and become quite tanky to physical damage later, as well as the turrets do not have ramping damage or armor penetration. Meanwhile, they are a gigantic obstacle and a tier 1 turret (as an average non pusher champion) may take you up to 5 creepwaves to kill if the enemy leaves it unattended. Compare to turrets in league where you can take an unattended turret with 1-2 creepwaves as any champ. It's just that in any decent elo trying to take an unattended turret is met with 2+ teleports immediately and you push is killed, so the games tend to stall until a teamfight happens or something and people die.

I think a better example would be Smite's towers.  They tickle, even at level one, but not even attack speed based hunters like Apollo can take them down particularly easily.  It's not even that they don't fall easily, it's just that a single god isn't going to be able to dunk a tower single-handedly with little effort.  Hunters like Artemis and Apollo can take a tower down, but so can a mage like Kukulkan.  There isn't a gigantic discrepency.  

Meanwhile the gap between Karma and Tristana's tower taking abilities are night and day.  Even though that towers are made of paper mache in this game, Karma has no attack damage.  Meanwhile one EQ on a tower with half finished build and Tristana starts breaking towers like she just came from the flash game Crush the Castle.

Honeslty, at this point, keeping the fortification buff all game seems to be the only way to keep towers meaningful.  However, that would be extremely punishing to mages, who are already in an extremely bad spot right now.

Yes.  All the games I have enjoyed the most have been long and hard-fought.  Short games are unsatisfying.  Surrenders at 20 are the worst, and there's actually a thread asking Riot to *lower the surrender timer* rather than fixing the issues that lead people to want to surrender at 15.

I don't think anyone is asking for a 50 min average game time (not even me), but there shouldn't be 5+ towers dead at 15 minutes either or people feeling they're so far behind it doesn't matter what they do anymore.

It would be neat if it was constantly over exaggerated on the time towers are taken down, the average game length only went down by about 2 minutes this pre season.

The only reason games ending so drastically sooner is perceived as a widespread issue is because it's being used as an excuse for losing your games now from stomps.
